title: Strategic Design for Leveraging Structural Capital in University Organizational Learning: Social Network and Institutional Infrastructure-Based Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced expertise and extensive practical experience in the field: social capital management within organizations, understanding of university administrative systems, proficiency in digital collaboration tools, and experience in developing civic engagement strategies
context.additional_context: In-service university professors and administrative staff explore structural capital-building strategies through project-based collaborative learning: developing civic engagement strategies and institutional support systems for improving university culture, and seeking community linkage plans.

learning_goals: Design a systematic process for converting human capital in PLN (Personal Learning Networks) into organizational assets (structural capital): strengthening linkages between social networks and university systems.

Development of Three Social Indicators for Measuring University Organizational Learning Outcomes through PBL (Problem-Based Learning) Activities: Analysis of Collaboration Efficiency, Knowledge Sharing Frequency, and Contribution to Institutional Improvement

Implementation of Two Structural Capital Sharing Mechanisms in a Digital Tool-Based BYOD Environment: Culture Diffusion through Cloud-Based Knowledge Repository Construction and University Community Platform Operation
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
